intro: Rhabdadenia pohlii var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed rhabdadenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a warm, sunny climate. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
